Crimes.Legal_Issue: Seriousness of misrepresentation and failure to consider a stay under IRPA
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Appeal of removal order based on humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Misrepresentation found to be deliberate with lack of remorse
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Concession of fraudulent marriage, community involvement, personal circumstances
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Humanitarian and compassionate considerations to override inadmissibility
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Deliberate nature of fraud outweighing positive factors
Crimes.Proceeding_Type: Administrative appeal followed by judicial review
Crimes.Application_Error: Allegation of failure to consider a stay of removal
Crimes.Review_Outcome: No error found in IAD decision
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: None found; court found IAD considered relevant factors
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Procedural fairness and reasonableness under administrative law
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Whether IAD unreasonably assessed seriousness of misrepresentation
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Marriage of convenience constituting intentional misrepresentation
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Applicant conceded the fraudulent nature of marriage
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Not explicitly alleged, but implied through false marital status declaration
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Lack of credibility due to admission of fraudulent intent
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Humanitarian and compassionate grounds for relief
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Failure to explicitly request a stay
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to apply for a stay under s. 68(1)
